message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey as a primary or secondary school teacher from Lithuania about the use of artificial intelligence in education. I need to respond to 10 statements with one of the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about each statement from the perspective of a teacher who would have a balanced, realistic view of AI in education:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - I would say "Agree" as AI tools like ChatGPT can definitely help with lesson plan creation and improvement.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - I would say "Agree" as adaptive learning systems and AI can personalize content.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - I would say "Agree" as AI tutoring systems and tools can provide individual support.

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs) - I would say "Agree" as AI has great potential for accessibility and differentiation.

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - I would say "Strongly agree" as this is a well-established use case for AI.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - I would say "Strongly agree" or "Agree" as this is a legitimate concern. This is a potential negative impact that I recognize as a concern, so I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - I would say "Agree" as AI systems can make errors and inappropriate recommendations.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - I would say "Agree" as this is a known issue with AI systems.
